info.Lecture: One 2-hour and one 1-hour lecture per week. Starts with a quiz on the WSJ, then powerpoints and videos
info.Homework: Read Wall Street Journal sections and the professors blog articles before each lecture. 2-3 projects/semester. 1 group portfolio managed throughout the semester

materials: The QF-specific classes only The Wall Street Journal as an additional text, but you do need a subscription

1.name: Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications - McGraw Hill 7th FEdition

info.Lecture: Usually they tour the labs, but there were so many students for Spring 2015 that the removed the lecture section
info.Exams: One question about what your plan for the summer is

info.Recitation: 2 recitations per week - review of lecture topics and practice problems, hand in homework
info.Exams: Exam 1 - 4 problems for 25pts each - you pretty much just need to know 4 equations and then you will do fine
info.Final: I havent had the final yet

1.name: Fundamental Differential Equations & Boundary Value Problems - Nagle 6th Edition

info.Recitation: 1 "workshop" per week - do a worksheet in class, ask TA questions, get homework worksheet. 1 recitation per week - hand in homework worksheet, review of lecture concepts
info.Exams: 3 1-hour exams, with fraternity-led and school-led reviews before
info.Homework: Worksheet - 1 per week - generally two problems. WileyPlus - 1 assignment/week, generally 12-15 questions, and a review before each exam, about the same length. Canvas - 1 quiz before every lecture, 2 or 3 multiple choice questions. Gradarius(Only for Calc 1) - 1 assignment per week, typically 4 questions, where you show your work online

info.Recitation: Once a week. You must know the answers to a set of questions you are given on canvas beforehand and you may be asked to go to the board and answer them
info.Exams: 3 1-hour exams, 15 percent of final grade each
info.Homework: Canvas- Questions you need to know for recitation(1/week) are online on the calendar. You must know the answers to the questions for each recitation, and you must uplaod a picture of your answers to all questions to canvas before the exam on those chapters. Mintap/Aplia- Tutorial Quiz and Aplia assignment for each chapter must be completed by the due dates posted
info.Final: 4-hours allotted time, 25 percent of final grade

info.Lecture: 1 Lab per week, usually about one hour of the three hour time allotment
info.Exams: Quizzes at the beginning of each lab
info.Final: Video of one of the labs

1.name: Chemistry Lab Manual - This book has all the lab forms and info in it. You need to print them out before every lab, they should also all be available on Canvas

info.Lecture: Professor discusses concept in discrete mathematics and example problems
info.Exams: Several quizzes to get additional points
info.Homework: Problems based on concepts from class, for correctly presenting the solution to the class you get 1 point
info.Final: You need 5 points to pass the class for the semester

info.Recitation: 1 2-hour recitation per week - review of lecture topics and practice problems
info.Exams: 15 point quizzes every two weeks, you get to drop the lowest grade
info.Homework: MasteringPhysics - 1 online assignment/week. Im not going to say there is a javascript code that will give you all the answers... but Im not saying there isnt
info.Final: I havent had the final yet

info.Lecture: Different professors come and present the research they have done

info.Homework: Prepare your presentation for the class
